definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: This law get becoming a dead letter.
Such laws are, for the most part, still on the books.
sentences.chinese: 这些法令大部分现在还是一纸空文。

sentences.english: Without such accountability, any agreement would be empty words on a page.[/en]
sentences.chinese: 没有这种问责制度，任何协议都只是一纸空文。

sentences.english: This law has become a dead letter.
However, without the legislative support of national governments, international treaties are a mere scrap of .
sentences.chinese: 假如没有国家的立法支撑，国际协议只是一纸空文。

sentences.english: This agreement, if not implemented, is a mere scrap of paper.
sentences.chinese: 这个协定如不执行只不过是一纸空文。

sentences.english: Without money, your plan will be a prattle-prattle.
sentences.chinese: 没有钱，你的计划只能说一纸空文。

sentences.english: But it proved to be a hollow promise.
sentences.chinese: 但事实证明，他的许诺就是一纸空文。

definition: to exist in name only/empty shell/useless (idiom)
red-letterhead document, an official document with the name of the issuing government agency printed in red at the top, circulated to relevant bodies
to make frequent or unpredictable changes in policy (idiom)
the straw that broke the camel’s back (idiom)/the final straw
pinyin: ya1 si3 luo4 tuo5 de5 zui4 hou4 yi1 gen1 dao4 cao3
related.word: 压死骆驼的最后一根稻草

definition: The higher ups have policies while the lower downs have their own ways of getting around them. (idiom)
pinyin: shang4 you3 zheng4 ce4 , xia4 you3 dui4 ce4

definition: with an undeserved reputation (idiom); unwarranted fame/nowhere near as good as he's made out to be
to settle a matter by leaving it unsettled/to end up with nothing definite
